Network Components#

Node Class#

class tensorkrowch.Node(shape=None, axes_names=None, name=None, network=None, leaf=True, data=False, virtual=False, override_node=False, param_edges=False, tensor=None, edges=None, override_edges=False, node1_list=None, init_method=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Base class for non-trainable nodes. Should be subclassed by any new class of non-trainable nodes.

Used for fixed nodes of the network or intermediate, derived nodes resulting from operations between other nodes.

Parameters

  • override_node (boolean indicating whether the node should override) – a node in the network with the same name (e.g. if we parameterize a node, we want to replace it in the network)

  • param_edges (boolean indicating whether node's edges are parameterized) – (trainable) or not

  • tensor (tensor "contained" in the node) –

  • edges (list of edges to be attached to the node) –

  • override_edges (boolean indicating whether the provided edges should) – be overriden when reattached (used for operations like parameterize, copy and permute)

  • node1_list (list of node1 boolean values corresponding to each axis) –

  • init_method (method to use to initialize the node's tensor when it) – is not provided

  • kwargs (keyword arguments for the init_method) –

  • shape (Optional[Union[int, Sequence[int], torch.Size]]) –

  • axes_names (Optional[Sequence[str]]) –

  • name (Optional[str]) –

  • network (Optional[TensorNetwork]) –

  • leaf (bool) –

  • data (bool) –

  • virtual (bool) –

Return type

None

contract_between(node2, axes=None)#

Contract all shared edges between two nodes, also performing batch contraction between batch edges that share name in both nodes

Parameters

  • node1 (tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractNode) –

  • node2 (tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractNode) –

  • axes (Optional[Sequence[Union[int, str, tensorkrowch.network_components.Axis]]]) –

Return type

copy()[source]#

Copy the node, creating a new one with new, copied edges that are reattached to it

Return type

tensorkrowch.network_components.Node

dim(axis=None)#

Similar to size, but if a ParamEdge is attached to an axis, it is returned its dimension (number of 1’s in the diagonal of the matrix) rather than its total size (number of 1’s and 0’s in the diagonal of the matrix)

Parameters

axis (Optional[Union[int, str, tensorkrowch.network_components.Axis]]) –

Return type

Union[torch.Size, int]

disconnect(axis=None)#

Disconnect specified edges of the node if they were connected to other nodes

Parameters

axis (which edge is to be disconnected. If None, all edges are disconnected) –

Return type

None

move_to_network(network, visited=None)#

Move node to another network. All other nodes connected to it, or to a node connected to it, etc. are also moved to the new network.

Parameters

  • network (new network to which the nodes will be moved) –

  • visited (list indicating the nodes that are already moved to the) – network, used by this DFS-like algorithm

Return type

None

neighbours(axis=None)#

Return nodes to which self is connected

Parameters

axis (Optional[Union[int, str, tensorkrowch.network_components.Axis]]) –

Return type

Union[tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractNode, None, List[tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractNode]]

param_edges(set_param=None, sizes=None)#

Return param_edges attribute or change it if set_param is provided.

Parameters

  • set_param (boolean indicating whether edges have to be parameterized) – (True) or de-parameterized (False)

  • sizes (if edges are parameterized, their dimensions will match the current) – shape, but a sequence of sizes can also be given to expand that shape (in that case, sizes and dimensions will be different)

Returns

  • Returns True if all edges are parametric edges, False if all edges are

  • non-parametric edges, and None if there are some edges of each type

Return type

Optional[bool]

parameterize(set_param=True)[source]#

Turn a normal node into a parametric node and vice versa, replacing the node in the network

Parameters

set_param (bool) –

Return type

Union[tensorkrowch.network_components.Node, tensorkrowch.network_components.ParamNode]

Parameters

  • tensor (Optional[torch.Tensor]) –

  • init_method (Optional[str]) –

  • device (Optional[torch.device]) –

  • kwargs (float) –

Return type

Parameters

  • node1_axes (Optional[Sequence[Union[int, str, tensorkrowch.network_components.Axis]]]) –

  • node2_axes (Optional[Sequence[Union[int, str, tensorkrowch.network_components.Axis]]]) –

  • rank (Optional[int]) –

  • cum_percentage (Optional[float]) –

class tensorkrowch.ParamNode(shape=None, axes_names=None, name=None, network=None, leaf=True, data=False, virtual=False, override_node=False, param_edges=False, tensor=None, edges=None, override_edges=False, node1_list=None, init_method=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Class for trainable nodes. Subclass of PyTorch nn.Module. Should be subclassed by any new class of trainable nodes.

Used as initial nodes of a tensor network that is to be trained.

Parameters

  • override_node (boolean indicating whether the node should override) – a node in the network with the same name (e.g. if we parameterize a node, we want to replace it in the network)

  • param_edges (boolean indicating whether node's edges are parameterized) – (trainable) or not

  • tensor (tensor "contained" in the node) –

  • edges (list of edges to be attached to the node) –

  • override_edges (boolean indicating whether the provided edges should) – be overriden when reattached (used for operations like parameterize, copy and permute)

  • node1_list (list of node1 boolean values corresponding to each axis) –

  • init_method (method to use to initialize the node's tensor when it) – is not provided

  • kwargs (keyword arguments for the init_method) –

  • shape (Optional[Union[int, Sequence[int], torch.Size]]) –

  • axes_names (Optional[Sequence[str]]) –

  • name (Optional[str]) –

  • network (Optional[TensorNetwork]) –

  • leaf (bool) –

  • data (bool) –

  • virtual (bool) –

Return type

None

Edge Class#

class tensorkrowch.Edge(node1, axis1, node2=None, axis2=None)[source]#

Base class for non-trainable edges. Should be subclassed by any new class of non-trainable edges.

Used by default to create a non-trainable node.

Parameters

  • node1 (tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractNode) –

  • axis1 (Union[int, str, tensorkrowch.network_components.Axis]) –

  • node2 (Optional[tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractNode]) –

  • axis2 (Optional[Union[int, str, tensorkrowch.network_components.Axis]]) –

Return type

None

Change size of edge, thus changing sizes of adjacent nodes (node1 and node2) at axis1 and axis2, respectively

is_updated()[source]#

Track if shift and slope have changed during training, in order to set the new corresponding matrix

Return type

bool

make_matrix()[source]#

Create the matrix depending on shift and slope. The matrix is near the identity, although it might have some zeros in the first positions of the diagonal (dimension is equal to number of 1’s, while size is equal to the matrix size)

Return type

torch.Tensor

property module_name: str#

Create adapted name to be used when calling it as a submodule of a tensor network

TensorNetwork Class#

class tensorkrowch.TensorNetwork(name=None)[source]#

General class for Tensor Networks. Subclass of PyTorch nn.Module. Should be subclassed to implement custom initialization and contraction methods that suit the particular topology of each type of Tensor Network.

TensorNetwork can be instantiated to build network structures of nodes, and perform site-wise contractions, even though network contraction methods are not implemented. Useful for experimentation.

Parameters

name (Optional[str]) –

contract()[source]#

Contract tensor network

Return type

torch.Tensor

property data_nodes: Dict[str, tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractNode]#

Data nodes created to feed the tensor network with input data

delete_node(node, move_names=True)[source]#

This function disconnects the node from its neighbours and removes it from the TN

Parameters

node (tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractNode) –

Return type

None

property edges: List[tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractEdge]#

List of dangling, non-batch edges of the network

forward(data=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]#

Contract Tensor Network with input data with shape batch x n_features x feature.

Parameters

data (Optional[torch.Tensor]) –

Return type

torch.Tensor

Return type

property leaf_nodes: Dict[str, tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractNode]#

Data nodes created to feed the tensor network with input data

All the nodes belonging to the network (including data nodes)

Data nodes created to feed the tensor network with input data

parameterize(set_param=True, override=False)[source]#

Parameterize all nodes and edges of the network.

Parameters

  • set_param (boolean indicating whether the Tn has to be) – parameterized (True) or de-parameterized (False)

  • override (boolean indicating if the TN must be copied before) – parameterized (False) or not (True)

Return type

tensorkrowch.network_components.TensorNetwork

set_data_nodes(input_edges, num_batch_edges, names_batch_edges=None)[source]#

Create data nodes and connect them to the list of specified edges of the TN. set_data_nodes should be executed after instantiating a TN, before computing forward.

Parameters

  • input_edges (list of edges in the same order as they are expected to be) – contracted with each feature node of the input data_nodes

  • num_batch_edges (number of batch edges in the input data) –

  • names_batch_edges (sequence of names for the batch edges) –

Return type

None

property virtual_nodes: Dict[str, tensorkrowch.network_components.AbstractNode]#

Data nodes created to feed the tensor network with input data
